function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inhibition of centralised control of medical countermeasures by Member States' insistence on separating health law and EU internal market law.","Impact":"Inhibited response to contagious diseases, including procurement, stockpiling, and allocation of equipment and medicines.","Mitigation":"Re-negotiation of the proportionality principle to allow for centralised control of medical countermeasures.","Technologies":"N/A","People":"Public health practitioners, policymakers, scholars","Owner":"EU, Member States"},{"Description":"Relative weakness of the ECDC compared to international counterparts (e.g., CDC) and discrepancies between Member State responses to COVID-19.","Impact":"Ineffective coordination of response to contagious diseases at the European level.","Mitigation":"Creation of a public health authority at the European level with a clear mission and remit for global health.","Technologies":"N/A","People":"Public health scholars, policymakers","Owner":"EU"},{"Description":"Retreat to national self-interest in a time of crisis leading to discrepancies in Member State responses to COVID-19.","Impact":"Inconsistent and ineffective measures for controlling the spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Advocacy for cooperation and coordination among Member States in addressing public health crises.","Technologies":"N/A","People":"Member States, public health practitioners","Owner":"Public health practitioners, policymakers"}]}
